CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 24, 1967, pg. 1, reads: "Hot in Streets - William "Bouie" Haden, head of the militant United Movement for Progress, staged a noisy one-man demonstration at Homewood's Giant Eagle store which resulted in the supermarket chain agreeing to place a Negro manager in one of its stores by Sept. 30. Above, Haden taunts a Negro customer entering the store. Although some Negroes crossed the picket line, many by-passed the store. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Protest outside Giant Eagle Market, including William "Bouie" Haden wearing plaid shirt and facing away, man with sign reading "Business Today Housing Tomorrow," and police officers in background, Homewood
